alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 9:08PM PDT until May 22 at 7:33PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Spring snowmelt and rain from showers and thunderstorms will produce increased high flows on the Stehekin and Kettle Rivers. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM PDT Saturday was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 23.9 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 24.6 feet late tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage again Monday morning to 21.5 feet late Thursday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.6 feet on 05/28/1965. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Cold and swift flowing rivers can be life threatening this time of year. The combination of cold water shock and fast current increases the danger of drowning in our rivers. Keep an eye on children if they are playing near rivers and put a life jacket on them. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 315 PM PDT.
